supporting_spans: At five he saw her assassinated in inter-tribal strife; to stop further unrest his father ordered the murderer's entire clan executed, and the child never forgot the sound of flesh stripped from bone.
Glenarvan hesitated, and watched the Maori chief very attentively. "I do not know," said he, after a moment's silence. "Speak," continued Kai-Koumou. "Is your life worth that of our Tohonga?"
reasoning: Contradiction (factual): The character's actions and dialogue in the evidence directly contradicts the claim.

analysis.claim_text: His father guarded the island’s paramount chief; his mother, a princess from a neighbouring island, came in marriage to seal an alliance. At five he saw her assassinated in inter-tribal strife; to stop further unrest his father ordered the murderer’s entire clan executed, and the child never forgot the sound of flesh stripped from bone.

sub_claims.text: His father guarded the island’s paramount chief; his mother, a princess from a neighbouring island, came in marriage to seal an alliance.

At five he saw her assassinated in inter-tribal strife; to stop further unrest his father ordered the murderer’s entire clan executed, and the child never forgot the sound of flesh stripped from bone.
